Name: Silly Sounds
Description:
Silly Sounds is the new family-fun party game where everyone gets to make and guess the silly sound stuck on their headband!

The sound could be ‘An elephant asleep on a train’ or ‘A baby playing the bagpipes’! The only thing you do know… it will be very silly.

Spin and pick a player to make the sound, but land on ‘All Play’ and everyone makes the silly sound and all at the same time… it’s total mayhem!

Just beat the timer, guess the sound and the card is yours. Collect 3 cards to win the game, but watch out for the mute rounds where you mustn’t make a sound and can only act it out!

Making silly sounds is only half the fun, guessing them is the other half! Silly Sounds, the game you play with your ears!

—description from the publisher

Name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Rocky
Description:
Once a cool, but beautiful world, rich in natural resources, Rocky led a charmed existence as one of the first planets colonized by humankind. As a paradise settled by some of Terra's wealthiest citizens, its people wanted for little, and strife was rare for centuries. But like the Hegemony it belonged to, Rocky fell to the darkness of the Amaris years, and saw its killing blows come in the form of a rare battle between Houses Steiner and Davion at the dawn of the Succession Wars. Now little more than another ruined casualty of human avarice, Rocky is little remembered by the Inner Sphere at large"”save for the rumors of stolen treasures of the Star League, lost beneath its frozen wastes.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

Name: Marvel: Eye Found It!
Description: Search for hundreds of hidden illustrations in the Marvel Universe in Marvel: Eye Found It! while visiting Wakanda, Asgard, and everywhere in between on a large game board with your favorite Marvel characters.

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Ironheart Hero Pack
Description:
After a senseless act of violence took the life of her best friend and of her stepfather, Riri Williams used her supergenius intellect to reverse-engineer Tony Stark’s Iron Man design and create her very own power armor. Now she soars the skies as Ironheart, determined to rid the world of cruel fates like the one she once endured.

This high-tech hero boosts into battle in this expansion pack, which introduces Ironheart as a new playable hero along with her fifteen signature cards. With a pre-built Leadership deck ready to play from the get-go, you’ll be able to face down villains with Ironheart’s arsenal of armors from the moment you open the box. With the unique ability to gradually and permanently “level up” her armor for the rest of the scenario, Ironheart is a fantastic hero who can put in serious work for any team.

-description from publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: Dukes of Hazzard
Description:
A simple but fun board game,based on the famous TV series "The Dukes of Hazzard".  It was released in Greece in the 80's by Toys Art company. It can be played from 2-4 players. Each player in his turn rolls the spinner to determine how much spaces will he moves on the board. There is a unique space upon the spinner, which has the rule "Get a card". In that point, you must follow what card says. The winner is the player who reaches first the finish line.

—user summary

Name: Blind Faith: The Hussite Wars 1419-1434
Description:
Against the Odds #59

Blind Faith: The Hussite Wars 1419-1434

In A.D. 1415, at the Council of Constance, Jan Hus and Jerome of Prague, two church reformers from Bohemia, were burnt at the stake for heresy. In the years that followed, outrage over the execution convulsed civil society in Bohemia, a fief of the Holy Roman Empire. Now, with Bohemia in rebellion as well as consumed by heresy, the Emperor Sigismund must wage war to both extirpate the heresy and secure his throne.

The Hussite player's forces are largely Bohemians (i.e. Czech) and others, who, inspired by the teachings of Jan Hus, supported the taking of Communion with both bread and wine, along with other reforms of the Roman Catholic Church. The Hussites are in turn divided into two to three factions: the Calixtenes (Moderates), the Taborites (Radicals), and a later splinter group called Orphans. Moderates preferred to reform the church, while radicals wanted more comprehensive reforms, not only of the church, but of the state and society. Some even rejected church and monarchy. The Imperial player controls those forces under the Emperor and King, Sigismund of Luxembourg. (Note: Sigismund was still only King of the Romans in 1420. Although he was not crowned emperor by the Pope until 1433, he was still the ruler of Germany, in a nominal sense anyway.) They support the execution of Hus and oppose the taking of Communion with both bread and wine. Royal Crusaders, including both the Catholic minority in Bohemia and the Kingdom of Hungary are also under the direct control of the Imperial player. Papal Crusaders from the Holy Roman Empire (i.e. Germany) are under the indirect control of the Imperial player.

This bitter and sustained struggle devastated large parts of the empire in a manner not seen again until another religious conflict, the Thirty Years War, took place in roughly the same regions. The Imperial player must destroy the heretics and retake Bohemia before the Pope is forced to make concessions in another church council. The Hussite player, led by the devout, blind and gifted military leader, Jan Zizka, must prevent this and try to begin a Reformation in Europe one hundred years early.

Designed by Jason Juneau, Blind Faith depicts a classic example of asymmetric warfare, granting both players many options in waging war. The resources and position of the Imperial side are pitted against the skill and morale of the Hussite side. Storming and besieging towns become part of players' strategies for loot and victory. This war was part of a larger sea change in warfare in Europe. Knights and peasants, artillery and threshing flails, clergy and laymen were thrown together in a war the signaled the demise of the feudal system and the universal church.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Das große Jahreszeitenspiel
Description:
With Lilly through the year, you play in teams and learn about events of the year. 109 season cards show events and in addition a simple and a difficult question, the back has the answers. For a game, 20 random cards are placed ready. The active player chooses an easy or difficult question, rolls the appropriate die and moves Lili forward. If one can answer the question, the card goes out of the game, otherwise it goes under the pile. If Lilly passes over the call sign field, a new year begins. If the prepared pile is used up before 10 years have passed, everyone wins together.

—user summary

Name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Der Rote Engel
Description:
Berlin 1928: In the Babelsberg dream factory, the actress Zarah Leandros is on the verge of her breakthrough with her leading role in "The Red Angel". But then the glamorous film diva mysteriously dies in the Berlin nightclub "Kakadu". Has someone from her inner circle brought her career to an abrupt end? The spiritualist Prof. Magnusson wants to contact Zarah's spirit in the afterlife in a séance and find out what really happened. The Professor comes into play as a voice on the CD (or as an mp3 link).
-from the publisher-

At the start of the game, each player receives an individual booklet for their role. The game is played over 3 rounds. Each round, the players have to share information from their booklet and additional hints they receive. Before the final discussion after round 3, one person learns that he is the murderer. After each one's summation, a ballot is taking place. If the murderer gets the most votes, he loses. Otherwise he wins.

Name: Watershed Arizona
Description:
Throughout what is now known as Arizona, ancient civilizations constructed epic cities, harnessed the powerful and unpredictable rivers to water crops and sustain their communities, and thrived for thousands of years. Eventually, the unpredictability of the seasons, the power of the floods, and the fragility of infrastructure contributed to the abandonment of cities--leaving only ruins to mark these impressive achievements.

Today, modern technology and sheer hubris have resulted in a new set of settlements that again attempt to thrive in one of the world’s harshest and driest climates. With the help of modern engineering marvels like the Hoover Dam and the Central Arizona Project canal, more than 7 million people call Arizona home and over 100,000 more residents move there each year. How long can this continue before, like other civilizations of old, nature asserts its dominance and returns the cities to dust?

Watershed: Arizona is a turn-based asymmetrical game played in rounds. Each round consists of the following:
 1.    Revealing climate conditions card which modifies the precipitation coming to the watersheds
2.    Revealing and resolving policies that impact watershed conditions, city building and water infrastructure
3.    Simultaneous city building using workers and card playing
4.    Watershed stewardship and infrastructure building
5.    Delivering water to thirsty cities

Players will advance through eras that unlock new abilities, workers and actions—allowing the continued growth and development of their ambitious cities. Victory points determine the winner and are accumulated through achieving objectives, passing policies, stewarding watersheds, building districts and improving quality-of-life in cities, and conserving water through smart development practices.

Name: DetoNations
Description:
Manufactured in the USA!

Countries race to be the first in the world to successfully test a nuke to prove their superiority. Players take on the roles of various weird countries in a fictitious world, sifting through junk piles to find parts to build their own nuclear missiles.

On each player's turn, the active player draws Junk cards according to the number their country allows, then checks to see if they have a set of cards according to their country's Set number (could be 2 or 3). If they have enough, they trade those cards in for a piece of their Nuke and bring that new piece into play immediately (even if the new piece is worse than their current piece).

Once a country has all 6 parts for their own Nuke, they test it. To test it, there is a die associated with each piece of the Nuke, starting at a 4-sided die, then a 6-, 8-, 10-, 12-, and finally a 20-sided die. Failure means the failing part is destroyed and the country must save up enough junk to replace it. If all parts test successfully, then STOP THE PRESSES, that country wins.

Name: New World Order Game
Description:
New World Order - the game of future - is an fast paced game  with easy set-up and game-play mechanics, but has plenty of strategy and players need to make good choices to win. You take the role of a globalist billionaire and your purpose is to collect different corporations and institutions (society has already collapsed) and by collecting them gain Achievements that are high-tech inventions or some other global development. 
When you collect 3 Achievements with the same color you will reach Big Goal which will change our future considerably here on Earth or Space.

In this boardgame/cardgame hybrid players are collecting Corporation cards from the table and adding them together to maximize their points. For those points they can buy Achievement tiles which are placed on the table like a pyramid. Achievements give Victory points.

When you collect a three Achievements that match (they have same color on them) then a Great Goal is achieved and player gains extra 500 points Victory Points for it, which is pretty good.

Every player has 3 actions from which they have to choose 1 on their turn. Game moves clock-wise of course. The first action is to choose same corporation card or cards from the table, second - buy an Achievement for the Corp cards points and third - player can throw away a card or a set to make room for other Corp cards. That is sometimes necessary since the slots for Corp cards are limited (7 slots for 2-3 player game and 5 slots for 4-5 player game).

These actions go quickly most of the time, but there are moments where player needs to take a look at his cards and tiles he/she has and think what direction he wants go. He could go for high Corp card points (by collecting more cards) to get the expensive Achievement or forgetting about the full set and take a cheaper Achievement tile from the pyramid with a suitable color to get the Bonus points.

Making things more interesting is that player can´t take any tile you want. He can only take a tile that is free which means it don´t have any other tile on top of it ( not even a on a corner). So there needs to be some tactics how to get to that tile that is unavailable at the moment. It helps if a player got "another action" card, then he can use it to take the two tiles in a row!

The good thing about the game is players can influence each other games by simple ruining other's plans and taking the cards (or tiles) he/she really needs.
Looking at other players despaired face is always fun! Don´t forget you are a ruthless globalist billionaire :)

The game ends when all corporation cards are played out and Achievement VP-s ja Great Goals are counted.Who has most VP-s will be the most powerful elite!

This game is great for people who don´t play games much and are afraid of extensive rules. Gameplay is easily learned in the first 15 minutes. 
For experts it could feel a bit of a filler game, but in my opinion it has too many tactical options to be that and the game goes on a bit longer for a filler (60-75 minutes for 3 players).

Also the game has deep theme and makes you think a bit where are we heading as a society. It is a great conversation starter and very fun to enjoy with a couple of beers! :)

For more information check out the game site www.newworldordergame.com

Name: Carnivorous
Description:
The shop was said to be minute and yet terrifying all at once. The patrons were both thrilled and horrified by what was inside. The very idea of man-eating plants! Well here we are, you and your shopkeeper friends have embarked on a truly hair-raising experience this time. Armed with your cloned assistants, just break the glass when you need a new one! And a cavalcade of customers ready to buy the most exotic plants, only the plants look awfully hungry. Ah, maybe we should rope off that area so no one gets too close?

Your goal: Gain the most points by being the most clever greenthumb!

Players will be using worker placement to feed the plants in the shop or add new plants to the shop in the form of dominoes. Players will stacking dominoes to create new levels with each level scoring for the greatest number of a value, with lower floors being hidden as the players stack, will they know what’s down below and plant those matching flowers in their greenhouses?

This tricky game of playing dominoes for the value and also stacking them gives players an elevated gaming experience. There’s also a dice customer or two each round who might visit the shop. Hopefully you can keep the man eating plants from doing what they do best! Or you may want to feed your opponents’ cloned shop assistants to the plants, but be aware that they also get the bonus you earn for doing so, while losing an assistant of course.

The game ends when the last domino makes it to the shop. Players score their greenhouses as multipliers with each level, maximizing their scores as they go.

Name: Dancing Mayfly: The Fly Fishing Trivia Game
Description:
The game begins when one of the 53 fly fishing destination cards is selected and placed in the middle of the game board - each presents a unique trip with details and cost. Anglers then move around the board with the goal of earning 3 Identification (ID) cards and enough cash to purchase the trip and win the game.

Cash is earned by answering trivia questions - the harder the question, the more it's worth. ID cards are earned by identifying images of aquatic insects, fly patterns, and fish species. During the journey around the board, anglers may land on luck squares, experiencing unexpected windfalls and pitfalls. Both luck and skill is required to win the game.

The first angler to enter the fly shop with 3 ID cards and enough cash to purchase the trip wins!

• Learn to identify aquatic insects, fish species, and fly patterns
• Advance your fly fishing knowledge including: techniques, equipment, fish science, aquatic insects, fly tying, & more
• Learn about fly fishing trips & lodges throughout the world

Name: Wasteland Racing
Description:
The race take place on a 6´x4´ flat surface where you place terrain and 5 point markers. You have to race thru the markers in order two times to win (two laps). At dispenser points you can get weapon, traps, shields a.s.o to use during the race.

Each turn you can do one of three things:


     Move: Move +D6”, pivot once by up to 90°, can use one item
     Drift: Move +D6”, pivot twice by up to 90°, can’t use any items
     Boost: Move +2D6”, pivot once by up to 45°, can’t use any items


First to finish two laps win.

Name: Select 5
Description:
This is a fun, quick, interactive game - with no turns.

Goal of the game is to get as many 'streaks' of 5 cards in a sequence. Players work mostly independently with the ability to steal the last card from an opponent.

Games is competitive with a mix of age groups.

Its a quick (less than 10 min), fun game with a need for skill but not much strategy.

—description from the publisher

Name: Jigsuw: Rainbow Hole
Description:
When building traditional jigsaw puzzles, there are several tactics people use. One can look for pieces by their image or their shape.One can build the whole puzzle at the same time or concentrate on building a specific section of it. Organise the pieces before starting to build or dive right into it. Doing the border first, looking for a one of a kind piece and so on.

In Jigsuw, players need to master not only the different tactics to build a puzzle but also when to change from one to another. They start by setting down the large circular core of the puzzle flat on the table. From there, the players divide the rest of the pieces among themselves, then it’s off to the races. They compete to set down the pieces against the starting circle as fast as possible until the puzzle is complete.

What makes Jigsuw interactive is that players don’t just try to build the puzzle faster, but instead they need to try block their opponents. You block their pieces when you set down all surrounding ones before they get the chance to put theirs down. At this moment they cannot play it. The game continues until no one can lay down any pieces. Whoever ends the game with less pieces blocked wins the match.

Name: Sköna Sverige
Description:
Sköna Sverige is a trivia game about the history of Sweden. Each of the 165 cards depicts a historical event on its front side, and has the year of the event on the back side.

There are two different gameplay modes: In the drafting mode, you try to arrange drafted cards into chronological order. The player with the fewest misplaced cards wins.

In the trivia mode, you try to guess the correct year by placing markers on the gameboard. The game is played over a fixed number of rounds, and whoever has the most points at the end wins.

Name: Parks and Recreation Party Game
Description:
Remember what's important in life: friends, waffles, and work!

Relive your favorite moments from the hit TV show in Parks and Recreation Party Game. Pick one of Pawnee's famous parks and recreation projects, make deals, and recruit help. You probably need to work with your colleagues to get things done, but if you can take more credit, you'll earn sweeter rewards. When Li'l Sebastian is done eating, the game ends and whoever has the most waffles wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Blanc Manger Coco: Plein les Urnes
Description:
Blanc Manger Coco - Plein les Urnes is the Blanc-Manger Coco extension on the 2022 presidential elections. More broadly, it addresses the subject of politics from an electoral angle.
The association of question cards and answer cards makes it possible to create discrepancies, and therefore to laugh.

Name: Lapidarius
Description:
To become the most prestigious luxury jewelry store in the city of dwarfs, the most beautiful gems and the most important buyers are needed. Unfortunately some customers can be very demanding, and this can cause some stress to the hardworking employees. Perhaps buying some gifts for these workers at the end of the week might make them happier?

The game is divided in 4 rounds and each round has two phases. On the first phase, customer cards and gem cards are opened on the table and players secretly distribute their discount tokens on their boards. Then, each customer will buy a gem from the player who offered the best discount. Some customers cause the staff's mood to go down. Then, on the second phase, present cards are opened and each card is auctioned by players. The gifts can be used to improve the employees´ mood and avoid negative points at the end of the game.

After the fourth round all players get points acording to the clients attended, gems sold, the employees' mood and the money left. The player with the most points is the winner.

Name: 単語探知機タンタンゴ (Word Detector Tantango)
Description:
In Word Radar Tantango, the players are the developers of a next next next generation communication tool, the read-your-mind-machine: Tantango. But! You must demonstrate the machine to the evaluation committee sponsoring your machine, despite knowing that the machine isn't ready at all! Try to cooperate with your teammates to avoid getting everyone fired.

The game takes place on a board which resembles a radar screen.  Players will be placing hint tokens at the coordinates of their individual preference along two axis which will be determined.  One player will be trying to guess the word which the other players are hinting at.

Players are dealt a number of cards showing words and a number of dry erase boards where they will write words that can be used as an axis label to determine where a word belongs. The players' word cards are collected and combined with some undealt cards.  From a public display of some of these cards, a specific one is chosen.  One player then chooses the two dry erase boards to label the axis.  Each player then places a token where they think the secret word fits in the two-dimensional grid.  Then, the player who was not shown the secret word attempts to guess it.  If they are correct, the team gets a point; if they are not correct, please be kind and remember you are a team.

The game includes a scoring table to evaluate your performance.

Name: Deeproot Dwellers
Description:
In Deeproot Dwellers, each player controls a village of unique critters in an attempt to beautify their town over ten seasons. Building an efficient deck, growing a well curated garden, and moving up the exploration track are all viable ways for players to collect points.  With multiple paths to victory, and limited actions on the board, players need to be strategic about how they grow their village.

Each round (or season) has 3 phases: Action, Resolution, and Cleanup.

During the action phase, players will play dweller cards from their hands onto different action spaces on the board.  This functions like a worker placement style game where your cards represent the workers.  During the Resolution phase, the table will go down the board, section by section and resolve the effects of each section. The various areas allow players to collect resources, move up an exploration track, deal with effects for each Season, recruit new dwellers to join their village, thus adding them to their deck like a deck builder and finally the last area allows players to grab Flower tiles which provide points in a set-collection style of scoring. The Cleanup phase occurs where the board is cleared of each players dweller cards, each player draws a new hand of dweller cards for the next round, and a new Season card comes in to effect which offers a unique way to score in that round.

At the end of ten seasons (rounds), the player with the most points will be declared the winner.

It offers a unique blend or modern gamers' favorite mechanics wrapped up with great artwork and a whimsical, fun theme, that is easy to learn and teach.

Name: Quartz:  Kidz
Description:
All mining dwarves in their early childhood already attended the greatest institution of teaching of mining techniques in the kingdom. Hands-on activities are part of the day-to-day lessons at the school, where young dwarves learn to distinguish precious crystals from worthless stones. The kid who gets the best set of crystal will receive the much-desired best student medal!

Starting with the youngest player and going clockwise, each player will explore the mine until they decide to leave and end their workday. When exploring the mine, the player draws a stone from the bag. Colored stones can be turned into medals. Two gray stones cause an accident that ends the workday. Ending the turn without having an accident grants the player two bonus medals. After everyone has explored the mine for three rounds, the game ends and players line up their acquired medals next to each other on the table. Whoever has the longest line of medals will be the winner.
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: The Traveling Cat Game
Description:
The Traveling Cat Game is a board game with the goal of completing a world map from 108 tiles while moving a cat named Ricky from region to region.

Players work from an initial set of tiles that, like a puzzle, make up parts of the map. They continue to draw a tile at each turn, using the tiles to correctly build out the map, but only setting tiles in the regions where Ricky the Cat is currently visiting. Players can only move the cat to new regions based on their play. Some caution is required to ensure your tiles actually correspond with the country or land mass you intend to use them on. Knowledge of global maps or experience with puzzles is helpful.

The winner must get all their tiles onto the map first, and this is best accomplished by retaining tiles for strategic regions, passing or acting on certain opportunities, and, maintaining options to move Ricky the Cat when and where desired. After someone wins, the remaining players can continue the game to complete the global map competing with moves to use up their tiles soonest.

Name: Unsettled: Koguya
Description:
Untangle an ever-changing planet-sized knot of vines to reveal hidden secrets and the means to go on going on. Unsettled: Koguya is the 7th planet box for "Unsettled".

Koguya is a massive tangle of tanglies; a rubberband-ball-like orb of entwined vines that are grabbing, pulling, and throwing you about as you attempt to do what needs doing. Launch yourself around on spring-like vine coils, swing from place to place like a classic jungle fantasy, and slip through tunnels as you scavenge your way through the various refuge and space-waste the vines have plucked up and claimed on their eons-long journey across the cosmos.

—description from the publisher

Name: Unsettled: Blackout
Description:
Restore power to the Scarab before a malfunctioning Luna turns your lights out for good. Unsettled: Blackout is the 8th planet box for "Unsettled".

Research on a mysterious substance has triggered a bizarre explosion, plunging the ship into near-complete darkness and compromising Luna, who no longer recognizes you as friendly. You must find a way to get the power back on while thwarting Luna's attempts to de-conscious you. Pile equipment into barricades, distract her with loud noises, or just jump out the airlock if she gets too close. Whatever you do, don't let her catch you; you know all-too-well how effective she is.

—description from the publisher

Name: Unsettled: Gniir
Description:
It's kill-you-instantly cold outside. Somehow, that's the least of your problems. Unsettled: Gniir is the 9th planet box for "Unsettled".

An eerie, ethereal sense of uncertainty haunts every moment on this frost-goth world of ice and stone. Monolithic ruins loom in the distance, eerily preserved, disturbingly quiet. More unnerving yet, is the presence you can sense but cannot see. You feel it, in the howling wind, in the drifts of snow, around you, inside you.

Gniir is about finding shelter from more than just the elements. The resources you need can be found, but only in places you can't survive. It's a whole thing. You'll work it out.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle Pufs
Description:
Battle pufs is an action packed game for friends and families.
There are 2 modes battle royale where you win by being the last one standing. 
Or timed royale you set a timer and either the last player wins or if there are still players remaining you count the stars at the bottom of your puf cards and the player with the most stars wins. You shuffle both decks and deal 3 puf cards to each player and they get 7 battle cards unless otherwise stated.

Everytime they end there turn or use a card they draw back up to 7 reveal cards face up infront of you. Keep doing this until no one is left or you run out of time.

Name: Inflatable Antler Ring Toss Game
Description:
Enjoy this hilarious game at all your holiday parties. Your friends and family will love tossing the rings onto these inflatable antlers All ages will have a blast using this as an excuse to throw things at your head! Easily inflate the antlers and you are ready to play the game.

One person wears antlers that are inflated and the other players/teams toss inflatable red and green rings, trying to hook the rings over the antlers. Play until a certain score is reached (5 points for a short game, 20 for a long one).

Name: Unsettled: Survival Task Pack 1
Description:
Survival tasks concepts informed and inspired by the community during the Unsettled campaign.

Includes 3 survival Task D cards each for Wenora, Grakkis, and Zehronn

Name: Unsettled: Scientific Specializations
Description:
This expansion adds unique actions to unlock for each crew member.

Use your scientific specialization in tandem with environment-specific comprehension to perform actions unique to your character.

Lean on your scientific training to discover how all of this peculiar, newly-acquired comprehension has significance that could keep everyone breathing a bit longer. With the Scientific Specializations module, your "aha!" moments allow you to specialize in ways others cannot—which is a good thing if you all want to survive whatever "this" is and celebrate all of those breaths you've taken for granted.

—description from the publisher

Name: Unsettled: Scientific Fascinations
Description:
Give in to your idiosyncratic intrigues...perhaps at the expense of your crew...in the hopes that your mind can solve what others haven't been able to.

Take the gamble—use the insights you gain to fill in the mysterious gaps you've been pondering throughout your life instead of the application outlined for the task at hand. If your intuition services you as well as your intellect, let your curiosity lead you to understanding in lieu of rational thought alone. THere's more to life than what you were taught.

—description from the publisher

With this module, whenever you gain an Insight, a player can instead choose to advance their chosen personal Fascination. Each time you complete the Fascination track, the player receives the reward on their Fascination board. Thus, the player decides if they wish to pursue their Fascination reward at the expense of pursuing Comprehensions and Breakthroughs.

This module introduces eight Fascination boards. At the start of the game, each player chooses one Fascination board and attaches it to their player dashboard.

Name: Total Contamination
Description:
A science outpost on an icy moon. The bio-filter A.I. has mysteriously crashed. One of you has been infected with an alien form that can assume your whole identity. Can the humans reboot the A.I. or make it to the launch vehicle before the hidden infection achieves Total Contamination.

In this game all players begin in human form but one of you is secretly an alien infection that has assumed the guise of one of the humans. During play, infected players may infect others. The uninfected humans struggle to expose and defeat the aliens. The aliens attempt to defeat and contaminate the humans. However if too many humans become contaminated, then the aliens will turn on each other.

The game board represents a small, domed science station on an icy world, with a launch vehicle ready for lift off outside.

At the start of the game there is only one infected card in play. As play progresses more such cards accumulate and infected characters may end up infecting others by sharing to them. Each turn players choose one or two actions (move, combat or a task). The location on the board will make certain tasks available, such as using the bio analysis drone from the drone hub. Other players whose characters are nearby can help, hinder or watch. Cards are played to show how things turn out. When the dust settles the active player also gets to share cards with someone who helped or hindered.

If a player is forced to reveal an infection card in their hand face up, then their character changes from human form (blue) to monster form (red). Monster form can perform fewer tasks but can easily attack and infect others.

The game ends when one of these conditions is met:

     the AI is fully reprogrammed using uninfected cards, or with 2 or 3 infected cards giving an infection win
     the launch vehicle lifts off. If any character on board is infected that becomes an infection win.
     all players are in monster form, which produces an infection win.


If a human victory occurs, all uninfected humans win.

If an infection victory occurs only a limited number of infected players win, as the infection organisms are very competitive.

Name: Raon: 10th Anniversary
Description:
To celebrate the 10th anniversary of the most popular Hangul boardgame Raon, Gemblo, inc. published Raon: 10th Anniversary.

It features deluxe components such as a velvet bag and golden color printed tiles. It has more tiles than the base game, so it can be played with up to five people. And the rule book includes total of twelve rules, from the first edition rules to the rules that are newly developed for this edition.

Examples of new rules included in 10th Anniversary edition:

Guess - Select a theme and each player makes a word related to the theme, then players figure out what words the other players made by guessing each consonant or vowel tile.

Connect - Players take turn making a word using their tiles. After the first player makes a word. The following players must use 1 syllable from ‘the previous word’ when they make a new word.

Recombine - This is the rules for Raon championship and any other tournaments.

Name: Escape Box: Chtulhu
Description: Through 3 scenarios, with several levels of difficulty, the Escape Game settles in your living room. Hide the clues in your home, and above all, try to solve the riddles to save the world of the Ancient God in less than 60 minutes.

Name: 20 sekund challenge
Description: Two teams, one judge, over 400 crazy challenges and only 20 seconds to not get beat! In the 20 second challenge, players will have the opportunity to try their hand at completing a series of non-obvious, surprising and crazy tasks. The faster you tackle the challenge, the less time you leave for your rivals. An amazing party game that will make you laugh to tears!

Name: 02 Hundred Hours: Night Raids in World War II
Description:
02 Hundred Hours is a skirmish wargame focusing on night-time raids in World War II. Inspired by classic war movies as well as historical events, battles are fast paced with roughly 10-20 models on either side.

Field an elite force of Commandos, SAS, Paratroopers or Rangers to infiltrate the enemy lines under cover of darkness. Recruit SOE spies and local resistance fighters to bolster your chances.

Launch attacks on radar stations, munition factories, airfields, bridges and rail lines. Sneak past sentries, take them out with silent attacks, or open fire with a devastating ambush. Plant charges to destroy your objective, assassinate a target or grab vital intel, then fight your way to safety before reinforcements arrive.

Or play as the defenders, carefully setting patrol routes so your sentries can spot raiders in the shadows, utilise guard dogs, officers or even the dreaded Gestapo and make use of informants and intercepted transmissions to thwart the attackers’ plans.

All fighters have a 180 degree field of vision, so cannot see behind without turning. Enemies are not visible in the darkness and must be detected before you can react to them.

The attackers start each mission creeping forward through the night, aiming to stay covert, timing their movement to sneak behind patrolling sentries. If they are careless, or a sentry turns at the wrong moment, the defenders may detect them and grow suspicious, closing in and eventually raising the alarm.

At this point the defenders get reinforcements and can open fire on the raiders! But even then, it is vital to locate enemy soldiers - both sides can only attack foes once they've been spotted!

—description from the publisher

Name: Simply Foot
Description:
Defend, defend and defend! Today you are facing the best team in the championship, you have been preparing for this event for long weeks by developing a tactic called The Mega Bus. You suffer but are well fielded in your half of the field, your players in the middle "Cut out" everything that passes and your defenders are well grouped in your area. As a last bastion, your goalkeeper resists, left, right, but begins to wear himself out... You have to hold on! It's up to you to achieve the perfect steering by making the most of your counterattacks?

Throughout the game, your objective will be to protect your goalkeeper's HP as much as possible from opposing attacks and penalties. For this you will play Defense, Middle, Recovery and Special cards. Attackers score goals when your goalkeeper has 0 PV left , but if you can resist attacks , you can counterattack by accumulating dice and score goals.

The game ends when the cards deck is empty and the winner is declared. You win by winning the match!!

Name: The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge
Description:
A crate full of unique physical puzzles, and the story of a lost civilization. Solve the puzzles. Find the treasure. Escape the maze.

The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge will include hands-on physical puzzles, paper puzzles, mechanical puzzles, ciphers, folding puzzles, logic puzzles, illusions, riddles, and pattern games. We are designing each puzzle ourselves specifically for The Labyrinth, and are placing an emphasis on immersive puzzles with physical objects and unique solutions.

To complete the challenge, you must use clues to solve many smaller puzzles, which will lead to other clues in a larger interwoven narrative. Once you solve the smaller puzzles, you can  combine the solutions in order to unlock and solve the overarching meta-puzzles.

Solving all of the puzzles in the Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge will provide at least 8-10 hours of puzzle-solving and clue-cracking for a group of 3-4 people. The challenge can be played individually or with a group, and the game includes a huge number of puzzles and associated content. We have designed puzzles that will be accessible to people who have never participated in a puzzle hunt or escape room, as well as puzzles that will challenge even the most experienced puzzle hunters and escape room addicts. Some puzzles will be easily and quickly solved, while others require a more in-depth examination. The complete Labyrinth challenge is designed to provide hours of entertainment and immersion into this unique experience, with a story that unfolds as the puzzles progress.

—description from the designer

Name: Nidavellir: Idavoll
Description:
Idavoll is the second expansion for Nidavellir. During the first three rounds of the Age 1, the second tavern offers Mythical Animals, Aesir, Valkyries, and Giants, which add an additional round to the game. Each new type of card also adds never-before-seen effects.

Gods: When you recruit a God, put the card in your Command Zone with 1 Power token on it. Discard this token to use the God's power.

Giants: When you recruit a Giant, put the card in your Command Zone and place 1 Capture token at the bottom of the column of the matching class. Each Giant lets you capture a Dwarf of the matching class.

Valkyries: When you recruit a Valkyrie, put the card in your Command Zone with 1 Strength token on the highest notch. Whenever you meet one of the Valkyrie's requirements, move the token down a notch. At the end of the game, earn victory points depending on the position of the token.

Mythical Animals: When you recruit a Mythical Animal, place it in your army in the matching class. Each animal has its own unique ability.

Name: Something Wild! Star Wars: Boba Fett
Description:
Something Wild! Star Wars: Boba Fett is a fast-paced, light card game. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs, just like in Rummy. Power cards specific to the included character add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay. The first player to score three powers wins.

You can combine multiple Something Wild! games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to a game.

Name: Something Wild! Marvel: Spider-Man
Description:
Something Wild! Marvel Spider-Man is a fast-paced, light card game. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs, just like in Rummy. Power cards specific to the included character add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay. The first player to score three powers wins.

You can combine multiple Something Wild! games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to a game.

Name: Love Letter to Lady Luck
Description:
The King wants to stop the many love letters arriving in the castle. So he arranged for prospective suitors to temporarily come and meet all the ladies to earn their trust. The suitor with the most support from the ladies is permanently allowed inside the castle.

Love Letter to Lady Luck (LLLL) is the sequel to the widely acclaimed game, Love Letter. As it shares the same background world setting, the art and layout is the same as "Love Letter". However, it plays differently from the original.

You bid on cards which you either use as collaborator or score cards. The collaborator cards help you gain better cards or manipulate your own or your opponents' decks. But score cards help you win the game.

You can also play Goita with the same cards.

Released as part of Princess Wonder.  It was not released in a separate retail edition.

Name: Charlatan
Description:
Somewhere on the French Riviera:

The town is brimming with wealthy, gullible targets.  But too many Charlatans in the same area might ruin this Con Artist oasis. So! Since you all know each other;  you’ve agreed to these terms:
Who ever gets away with the most money this summer, gets to have the place for themselves for good.

It’s going to take every trick in the book to pull this off. Every con, scheme and exit strategy you know, must be put to use, if you’re planning on having this oyster for yourself.

Charlatan is a 1-4 player asymmetric take-that/push your luck card game,  where each player tries to get away with as much money as possible, while also trying to sabotage their rivals.

Each card is unique and gives the players the option of actually telling a funny story of how they win a Target's trust  or getting away with millions, which can make it somewhat entertaining having your target stolen by another player.

Through a combination of different cards; Cons, Long Cons, Combo Cons, Schemes, Arrangements and Exits,  you'll scam and swindle your way through to becoming the biggest Charlatan of them all!

—description from the designer

Name: Cafe Rush
Description:
A top speed, high energy,  family-friendly card game that’s perfect for parties.

Don’t keep your customers waiting; serve the food they ordered as fast as you can!

In this fast & frantic card game, play table cards, then fill their orders by playing food cards onto them. The catch? Everyone can play on anyone's cards, and everyone plays at once!

Serve the most tables and play the most cards overall to score big points and get the "tip jar" bonus!

—description from the designer

Name: Octopie
Description: Octopie is an undersea race to gather eight matching arms for your octopus! Roll the die to see whether you draw from the octo-pile, flip over a tentacle tile to reveal the color lying beneath, or swap with an opponent. Find an arm holding a pie, and you get a tasty extra action to help win the race. Be the first to complete your octopus to win.

Name: Chonky Donkey
Description: Each player in Chonky Donkey has a hand of question cards. In a round, the active player draws a card from the answer deck and reads it out loud. Each other player in turn chooses a question card from their hand and reads it, after which the active player must give their answer without laughing. If the active player succeeds in keeping a straight face, they keep their answer card as a point; otherwise they give it to the person whose question made them break. Play until someone collects the required number of points to win.

Name: Millennials vs. Boomers
Description:
Floppies? Beepers? Emojis? Memes? The generational divide is alive and well. See how well you know the generation you love to mock. From tech to tunes to terminology, Millennials and Boomers go head to head in this LOL, pop culture trivia game.

Not a boomer or millennial? Not to worry, this is a game every generation can play.

Perfect for trivia night, family game night...or any night.

Name: Birthstone
Description:
Birthstone is a competitive board game that takes place deep in the heart of the bustling Sulperra Market. In the game, players take on the role of artisan jewelers who bid against one another for precious gems, metals, and reagents in order to craft valuable artifacts for the wealthy elite.

Players take turns placing their apprentice tokens (workers) on various locations on the game board to take a variety of actions, including bidding, mining, and reagent procurement.

The game ends when the last of the commission cards is completed, and the player with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: CookPot!
Description:
The best chefs are in the town.
But the best cannot be many!
Cooking competition was held to determine the superiority!
In addition to cooking skills, you need "a little bit" of luck to win.

Gather ingredients!
Use cooking tools!
Treat guests!
Be the best chef!

There're 5 cooking ingredients. Meat, Fish, Vegetable, Wheat, Rice. You can get these ingredients with cards or dice. Draw an 1 card or roll 2 dice. The cards belong to the individual, and the dice belong to everyone. Therefore, only roll the dice when you are sure!

If someone makes 5 dishes, game ends. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Deviation
Description:
Path building game that uses tile placement with color coordinated line segments to move totems, with the objective to move the opponent to a designated "kill spot".

—description from the designer

Name: Skyway
Description:
In Skyway, you are a city planner in charge of designing a notoriously convoluted traffic interchange. Over three passes through the deck, you will be drafting stacks of cards from a random market, which you’ll place into a 3x3 grid. However, each grid cell may only be stacked three cards high - any more and the bottom cards get discarded. Your aim is to create a path of at least 5 increasing cards for each of the four suits.

Skyway is a solo pattern-building game playable with a deck of regular playing cards, with rules created by Wil Su and made available free online as part of his "Isaludo" series. On each turn, the player deals stacks of cards to a market, and then chooses one stack to build inside a 3x3 grid. Over three passes through the deck, the player tries to construct the grid in such a way as to create a five-card sequence in each suit -- a pathway formed by the cards that can snake around or intersect with the other suits' pathways. The catch is that each square on the grid can only hold a stack of cards three high, and placing the one card needed to complete one pathway may very well cause a card crucial to another pathway to be discarded.

Arranging tiles to create maps is a cornerstone of many great city-building games like Suburbia and Sprawlopolis. However, most games of this genre require more information on each card than a simple rank-and-suit system can provide. Skyway takes its cue from the Decktet game Aucteraden. By allowing a single space to have more than one “suit” on it, the paths can intersect and weave around each other to create a small, tight puzzle.

As part of the Isaludo collection, the rules can be found in this forum thread.

Name: Riot Quest: Arena Miniatures Game
Description:
The once-great Iron Kingdoms are now a pile of smoldering ruins, and there's treasure everywhere if you've got the gumption to fight for it! You'll need a crackerjack crew, gobs of gear, and lots of love for the chaos of battle if you're going to score the best leftover loot in the land — but it's every human, dwarf, elf, and goblin for themselves in this outrageous quest for bodacious booty!

Riot Quest is a fast-moving, highly unpredictable skirmish board game using hobby miniatures. First released in 2019 using hobby miniatures, Riot Quest has enjoyed three years of expansion and growth. The new board game edition will include 48 preassembled plastic miniatures and all the dice and accessories needed to play the game with up to four players.

Name: Riot Quest: Pe(s)ts Expansion
Description: The Riot Quest: Pe(s)ts Expansion features 24 miniatures, with six different pets in four colors. Pets are actually riot gear with corresponding minis that get placed on the board with your heroes, providing a bevy of wacky antics to drive your opponents crazy while helping you score more loot and bounties.

Name: Sailor Moon Crystal: Imposterous
Description:
The Deathbusters have captured someone from the Sailor Guardians team and replaced them with a Daimon imposter! By asking the team members questions and seeing whose answers don't align with the rest of the group, the team can unmask the imposter and direct the rescue of their captured teammate before it's too late.

In Sailor Moon Crystal: Imposterous, players take turns asking intriguing and open-ended questions related to the Sailor Moon Crystal series. Each player writes down an answer that they think will match the answer given by other players. The more answers a player has in common with the others, the more points they receive. The suspicious player with the fewest points each round, i.e., the one whose answers are most dissimilar from those of other players, might be the imposter and their pawn moves down the game board.

When a player — or multiple players! — exit the last space (Level 6) of the game board, the game ends with the imposter(s) having been revealed. All the remaining players win the game and rescue their captured teammate!

Name: Golden Ei
Description:
Can you get the bunny trio to the Golden Ei inn before the fox catches up to them?

In Golden Ei, you win or lose together. To set up, shuffle the 28 double-sided trail cards, flipping half the deck repeatedly to randomize which sides are face up, then lay out the cards in a trail with the Golden Ei inn card at one end and the Fox at the other. Place the bunnies 8-10 spaces away from the fox depending on how difficult you want the game to be, with each bunny on their own card.

To start, roll the die, then move the matching colored bunny (blue, red, yellow) forward one space. Next, choose the closest vacant trail card either in front of or behind the bunny just moved, then flip it. If the card shows 1-2 eggs in yellow, red, or blue, move the matching bunny forward 1-2 spaces, then once again flip over the closest vacant trail card either in front of or behind the bunny just moved. If you instead reveal 1-3 fox paws, move the fox forward 1-3 spaces, then pass the die to the next player, who rolls the die to start a new turn.

If the fox lands on a bunny, you lose, but if any bunny first lands on the inn, then they all reach safety!

Golden Ei includes six helper cards, such as a dice squirrel and a taxi stork, that you can add to the game. You start only 6-8 spaces away from the fox, but each helper animal provides a one-time benefit that will ideally keep you out of the fox's jaws.

Name: The Santa Claus Game
Description: They race around Santa's Workshop trying to load their sleigh with 5 toys. Once a Santa has 5 toys, they fly off to the town to deliver the toys. Along the way, Santas encounter fun activities like belting out their best "HO HO HO" or Singing their favorite Christmas carol. The first Santa to deliver all their toys wins the game.

Name: The Forgotten Kingdom
Description:
This is an adventure game, where the heroes are wandering around the Kingdom and facing challenges. They receive victory points for solving problems and dealing with monsters. Every completed challenge releases a memory piece from the Mine of Memories and helps the heroes to restore the forgotten Kingdom. The revealed memories reduce the difficulty of further challenges and earn extra victory points for the heroes.

The heroes’ task to get all the memories back from the mine and assemble the forgotten cities on the board to break the evil spell. Players do this by moving up to 3 spaces on the hexagon grid during their turn and either resolving tile events by playing their cards or placing their Memory Tiles to gain points.  The player who has the most points at the end of the game is the ruler of the Kingdom and wins the crown.

Name: Candy Land: Ice Cream Party
Description:
Players cooperate to stack toppings onto a balanced Ice Cream dish. If the last piece is added to the dish, all players win, however, if it falls over, the player whose turn it was loses.

If playing solo, see how many toppings you can add before the dish falls over.

Name: Western Legends: Big Box
Description:
The Western Legends Big Box is more than just a box, its also a complete wooden storage solution that holds every single item (except the playmat) from the Game: Western Legends series. Contents vary with version purchased.

The Alllll In version includes all upgraded components, the hardcover rulebook, and stores all game boards as well! It also comes with unique never before seen character cards and a legendary item!

The New In Town version has a softcover rulebook and does not include playmat and some of the component upgrades.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Cuius Regio: The Thirty Years War
Description:
In May 1618, two imperial regents of the Habsburg Empire, along with their secretary, were thrown from the window of the council room in Prague Castle for violating an agreement that protected Protestant religious rights. The act, known as the Defenestration of Prague, marked the beginning of 30 bloody years of warfare—the Thirty Years War.

Cuius Regio explores the operational military aspects of this pivotal period in European history and focuses on the maneuvers and battles that shook Europe for three decades.

The game includes scenarios covering the Bohemian Revolt, the Danish intervention, the Swedish intervention, the French intervention, and a Thirty Years War campaign of 31 turns lasting from 1618 to 1648. Each scenario has a unique character, and the game can be played in as little as an hour and a half (for a short scenario) or can be a multi-session game for the full campaign.

The turns are divided into two seasons (summer and winter), and each turn has a variable duration that depends on the number of armies activated. In addition, armies can conduct operations several times but become less effective as they accumulate fatigue during each action.

Combat is an integrated system for field battles and sieges and is resolved by a die roll, modified by each army's leadership, composition, and condition, on a simple Battle Results Table.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Chopping Block
Description:
Chopping Block is a fast paced card game for junior- and mid-level executioners where you need to outbid your unscrupulous coworkers for the juiciest contracts in town. If you're lucky you'll even have time for a cup of your favorite hot beverage.
Probably coffee. Definitely coffee.

The game is a card game for 2-5 players with bidding mechanics and cut-throat player interaction to gain the most gold. You gain gold and influence by fulfilling contracts for executions of various nobles (and other unfortunates….). You can spend both Gold and Influence during the game to get benefits or sabotage your executioner colleagues' work.  The player with the most gold at the end of the game wins.

Name: Vanksford
Description:
Hundred of years ago the world was dominated by six races: Humans, Dwarfs, Drakes, Beasts, Elves and Orcs. They control their own kingdoms briefly knowing the existence of the others. Until the big calamity falls in their kingdoms destroying their places and turning it uninhabitable. One traveler called Vanksford discovered a huge and prosperous land, not ruled by anyone, the rumor traveled all over the six destroyed kingdoms, and since then all the empires started a war for the lands of Vanksford.

Vanksford is a 2 to 6 player, based on strategy and luck none will be out of this board game, you could play it as teams or not, making it playable for all the family. Per turn every player will collect the materials based on the dice throw, move the troops and realize attacks against other players.

Name: King of New York: King of Tokyo Power Up!
Description:
It's chaos in New York!

With these new printable Evolution cards, you can now play as any King of Tokyo monster in King of New York!

Includes: Cyber Kitty, Meka Dragon, Space Penguin, Alienoid, The King, Pandakai, Gigazaur.


King of New York: King of Tokyo Power Up! Print N' Play expansion adds King of New York Evolution cards for King of Tokyo monsters, and differs from the other Power Up! expansions on the following:

King of Tokyo: Power Up!: added Evolution cards for King of Tokyo monsters.

King of New York: Power Up!: New King of Tokyo and King of New York Evolution cards for King of New York monsters to be used in King of Tokyo.

Name: You Win
Description:
You Win is a massive multiplayer card game for larger parties, events, and conventions. Players start with an equal number of You Win cards each (at least 1) and face off in quick 1 vs 1 games. The winner, determined by a couple of card flips, will take up to as many cards as they played from their opponent (while keeping any cards they played). The player with the most cards at the end of the event wins the whole game. But players don't know how many cards are in the pool, how many cards other players have, or how many cards to play against each opponent.

The game can be played in-hand, in less than a minute, while standing or waiting. It's an ideal ice breaker game with player choice, luck, and exciting tie breakers. All the rules are on the card.

You Win is a massive multiplayer card game and is distributed as a Forever Free Print and Play Game for personal use.

Name: Neko Harbour: The Card Game – Fishing Boat promo card
Description:
Adds 10 extra Fishing Boat cards to the game, with their own ability to score extra points.

The designer added it into the Kickstarter version He also added it to the rulebook in the KS version. It was added after the game was finished.

A mini-expansion included in the first print run! With this expansion, players have more interactions with each other. Also, it increases the Coin's value. Now Coin has became an even more important resource for the game. Well... it's true that travels to Antarctica is expensive!
Includes 10 cards:
- 5 x Period 1 cards
- 5 x Period 2 cards

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Ms. Marvel
Description:
Kamala Khan was once a normal Pakistani-American girl in New Jersey who had an obsession with the career of Carol Danvers, a.k.a. Captain Marvel. When she was a teenager, a cloud of Terrigen Mists fell on the Jersey Shore, and she was accidentally exposed. When she awoke from Terrigenesis, Kamala discovered she had morphogenetic power that allowed her to alter her appearance, regenerate from injuries, elongate her body, and alter her mass at will.

Out of respect for her hero, Kamala took up the mantle of Ms. Marvel. She adds her strength to groups of heroes like the Avengers, where her idealist attitude and encyclopedic knowledge of heroes comes in handy... not to mention the smackdown of her embiggened fists.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mordo & Ancient One
Description:
Baron Karl Mordo learned his impressive magical ability by training with the Ancient One. He has long been one of Doctor Strange’s greatest foes. Baron Mordo has consorted with darker powers like Dormammu and the demon Mephisto in his efforts to destroy the Ancient One and the Sorcerer Supreme.

Born more than 500 years ago, the Ancient One was a mortal inhabitant of Kamar-Taj, a hidden mountain village. The Ancient One learned how to unlock the mystical power of the universe to work magic. Having seen firsthand the dangers of magic if used for personal gain, the Ancient One became the first Sorcerer Supreme. As one of the most powerful magic wielders in the world, the Ancient One has sworn to protect the world against evil magic and those who use it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Rival Panels: Spider-man Vs. Doctor Octopus
Description:
Take the famous rivalry between Spider-Man and Doctor Octopus to the table with the new Rivals Panels: Spider-Man Vs. Doctor Octopus character pack! In addition to being a brilliant scientific mind and ace freelance photographer, Peter Parker is the amazing Spider-Man, a hero who gained incredible superpowers after being bitten by a radioactive spider. Swinging through the streets of New York on his web lines and wall-crawling his way to the scene of a crisis, Spider-Man arrives just in time to stop the plots of his nefarious foe: Doctor Otto Octavius!

The man now known as Doctor Octopus was once a driven, ingenious researcher who graduated from M.I.T. at the top of his class. An accident while handling radioactive materials fused tentacle-like metal appendages to his body and damaged his mind, warping him into a twisted criminal mastermind and foe of Spider-Man.

—description from the publisher

Name: Escape from Sin's Curse
Description:
In Escape from Sin's Curse, it is the year 2911 and the Earth is a desolate wasteland, both physically and spiritually.  You are part of a group of scientists trying to figure out where everything went wrong.

Searching through an ancient library, you discover the Bible, which has been lost for centuries. After reading the story of Adam and Eve, your team of scientists decide to take a time machine back to the Garden of Eden to stop Adam and Eve from eating the forbidden fruit and putting a curse on all mankind.

Arriving on the scene just moments too late, you find yourself on a fact-finding mission to discover if there is any way to reverse sin’s curse.

Escape from Sin's Curse is an easy to learn escape room game with the cards slowly introducing players to new puzzles as the team progresses.  As the team travels through time to different Biblical events, players will need to look up relevant Biblical passages to solve some of the puzzles that appear.  Once Escape from Sin's Curse is solved, the team may give the game to another group since the game is reusable!

Name: Solitaire Legends: Tiger Lily
Description:
Solitaire Legends is a series of traditional-style solitaire card games based on popular myths and legends.

Tiger Lily is a solitaire game based on Peter Pan that can be played with a traditional deck of cards. The game was created by Jonathan Auffarth in 2022.

Long gone are the days of Captain Hook and the boy who wouldn’t grow up. Now, pirates battle for control over Neverland, and the Fairy Kingdom is enslaved. Their pixie dust is harvested as a weapon of war. Alas, a new hero rises. All aboard the Jolly Roger as Queen Tiger Lily leads the Lost Boys to free the fairies once and for all!

In Tiger Lily, you must take control of the Jolly Roger. To do so, Find and align 3 Lost Boys (J) in a vertical, horizontal, OR diagonal line. On your turn, play a card from your hand, resolve the action, and then draw back up to 4. Catch Fairies along the way, fight Pirates, and look out for the Crocodile lurking in the water below!

For more games in the Solitaire Legends series check out Guinevere and Maid Marian!
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Peter Pan

Name: Roll 'N' Wrestle: Territories
Description:
Roll'N'Wrestle is a modern day twist on the 1950-1980 Wrestling era with you taking the role of a pro wrestling promoter.

The United States of America is divided into territories and you must conquer these by hosting wrestling events and attracting fans to your promotion.

Lead your wrestling franchise to success and beat the competition by recruiting, training, and developing a winning roster of wrestling superstars.

You will roll dice acting as your road agents to complete worker placement strategic maneuvers for your promotion, plus deal with superstar egos, backstage rivalries and locker room politics, negotiate deals with TV networks and sell merchandise to your hopefully increasing loyal fan base! Plus so much more...

Do you have what it takes to beat ruthless rival promotions 
and conquer the world of Professional Wrestling?

Come and try in Roll'N'Wrestle: Territories the pro wrestling board game.

Name: Town Builder: Coevorden – Promo Cards
Description:
5 promos released as part of the Kickstarter.

Ceremony:  2VP. Building Type - Commerce. Resource Cost - 2 
           wood. Ability Type - Scoring. Building Ability - 
           Score 1VP for each judge you did not claim. 
           Resource - Straw and Stone.

Fields:    6VP. Building Type - Military. Resource Cost - 4 
           wood. Ability Type - None. Resource - Straw.

Granary:   1VP. Building Type - Housing. Resource Cost - 1 
           Straw. Ability Type - Star. Building Ability - 
           Discard this building to take 2 actions. Resource 
           - Wood and Stone.

Guildhall: 2VP. Building Type - Social. Resource Cost - 2 
           Stone. Ability Type - Build. Building Ability - 
           Gain a resource from the discard pile for each 
           award you claimed. Resource - Wood.

Monument:  2VP. Building Type - Culture. Resource Cost - 1 
           Gold and 1 Stone. Ability Type - Star. Building           
           Ability - Pay 1 Gold to complete a foundation 
           requiring only one more resource. Resource - 1 
           Straw. Also gives 1 Gold.

Name: BadNews
Description:
BadNews is a French implementation of Cards Against Humanity, based on the French YouTube show BADNEWS.

The lead player in turn chooses a News with a blank space, other players must choose an answer with a combination of two different cards maximum (Action or/and Bad) that must be funny.

The game, particularly provocative, is reserved for an adult audience.

Name: The Artist
Description:
A Deadbolt Mystery Society mini mystery.

Nicolas Polk was a gifted artist. Even as a student enrolled in Valley Falls University’s prestigious art program, his work always stood head and shoulders above the rest. Fittingly enough, Nicolas was announced as the winner of the annual LaBelle Art Show. Imagine everyone's surprise, however, when the young savant was found dead the next morning inside the art gallery. Can you catch the killer before they get away with a picture-perfect crime?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tech Chess
Description:
Tech Chess is a two-player, chess variant game where chess pieces each have abilities. It replaces the pieces with a modernized deck of playing cards called the Tech Deck. The cards represent chess pieces on the board each with special abilities. Played on a 6x6 board, each player starts with two kings, a knight, queen, two rooks and 6 pawns that can be upgraded. Players draw 3 cards from the deck at the start of the game. If you like chess, you'll enjoy Tech Chess.

On their turn, a player may do one of the following things, Move a piece, Use card effects, Upgrade a piece, Build a pawn.

Name: Feats of Cheese
Description:
In Feats of Cheese, physics and your fine motor skills are put to the test. Players take turns stacking cheese wedges to create tall towers. The taller the tower, the more points you earn. It takes a careful hand and an eye for balance to accomplish this feat.

Stack a cheese wedge on the matching color platform and add a mouse if you can. If you knock over the tower, your opponents score points and you score nothing! To score, players multiply the number of mice in the tower by the number of cheese wedges that match the platform. The player with the most points at the end wins!

Name: Txek Card Game
Description:
Pronouce Txek as "check", a reference to our origins: Basque Country across France and Spain.

This is a card game where each player has cards they can - and can't see.  The goal of the game is to be the first to discard all your cards by matching the cards on the discard pile.  But other players can use special cards to stop you along the way.

Similar game play to UNO but you can't see all your hand at once.

Name: La Clef: Astolie
Description:
La Clef is a story driven riddle game, not too far away from series like Unlock or Exit at heart.

The book tell the tales of a fantasy world named Astolie. It is divided in different chapters where the riddles can be solved independently. Solving all riddles of a chapter give hint on solving a final riddle that will unlock the next chapter. The story is divided in 5 chapters with a final riddle once everything is solved.

The riddles revolve around graphical puzzles, word puzzles, and hidden hints. The game also includes an UV light to unveil hidden parts of the story or solutions to some chapters. Hints and riddle  happen online via the Author's website and an active Discord community.

The authors claim the story takes about 50 hours to complete when playing with a group of 2-4 people.

Name: Pluzzables: Destinations
Description:
Pluzzables are “playable puzzles” - a collection of puzzles you play as games after assembly. Additionally, two web apps come with the game for simpler "match and claim" games. You do not have to put the puzzle together exactly in order to play Destinations. However, to play the online Pair Up game, all the pieces must be in their correct positions.

The Destinations edition is a puzzle of vintage travel posters. After assembly, the puzzle becomes a board game where players fly airplanes to various locations to collect lost luggage.

Players are given tickets that contain not only destinations, but a variety of actions that can influence movement of airplanes. On their turn, players roll dice, use a ticket, and either move, collect suitcases, or perform an action.

Once all luggage has been collected, the player with the most luggage points is the winner.

Name: Dose Cards
Description:
Dose is a wild, drink-giving card game. Players race to play or trade all of their cards. Each card can change the color, advance the game, or make your friends drink. Cards are played on their color, but some cards allow players to trade their entire decks or otherwise change the game dynamics wildly. The winner is the first player to play all the cards.

Similar to UNO, once a player only has two cards, they must shout, "Dose!" before another player realizes it or else they must drink and draw two cards.

Name: Hunt A Killer: Baker's Dozen
Description:
Baker's Dozen, America's most beloved baking competition show, is in trouble! One of the five remaining contestants is planning to poison one of the judges tonight during the live taping of the show's semi-final. The icing on the cake? If you alert the contestants that you suspect foul play, the killer will have a chance to escape.

Difficulty 1/5 (Easy)

—description from the publisher

Name: Horns Up!: Black Deck
Description:
An 18+ expansion, whose cards not only include new rules and Paths, but also new Audience cards regarding the less "family-friendly" (and most intriguing and fun) aspects of a concert.This expansion was developed hand in hand with the Lacuna Coil band, asking them about the most awkward and exciting situations happened during their concerts around the world. The result of their tales has become a deck of cards that are extremely... heavy. For this reason, it was decided to pair these episodes with the most “friendship-threatening” game mechanics.

Playing with this deck, you will have the chance to unleash your wrath against a single opponent -loading them with endless debuffs- or spread your evil ways on every opponent. This may call for revenge from your opponents, but keep headbanging and keep your Horns Up!

Name: Namiji: Aquamarine
Description:
In Namiji, you are two to five fishermen of yesteryear who are about to take a journey of discovery of beautiful and wild marine life. You will need to have a fruitful day at sea to win the game. To do this, you will have the opportunity to contemplate magnificent marine species, to fish with a line or a net to fill your racks with colourful fish and haul in your crustaceans traps.

Aquamarine is the first expansion for Namiji. It contains all the item stretch goals from the original Kickstarter campaign and a booklet containing the expansion's rules and the Boats' stories. The booklet is also available for download from the Namiji website.

Aquamarine adds the whirlpool and additional creatures to the game.  It is an expansion and cannot be played without the base game Namiji.

Name: Some 'R' Set Remastered
Description:
The Levi Game Company has remastered this many times played classic - the 1903 original midwestern USA card game, Some 'R' Set.  Levi first re-issued this game in 2019.

It plays very similar to Spades or Euchre. But the fact that each suit has a different number of cards, makes the strategy play each round.

Name: AuZtralia Big Z Box
Description: A kickstarter exclusive big box with Revenge of the Old Ones and TaZmania expansions (promo cards, big enough to also house the base game.

Name: Dungeon Doodle Duel
Description:
Dungeon Doodle is a two-player roll & write game in which one player takes on the role of Dungeon Lord to design a dungeon behind his player screen, while the other player plays the Hero trying to conquer it.

As Dungeon Lord, roll your dice to draw your Dungeon. Place Traps, Doors, Treasures and Monsters. Protect your Crystals. If you snatch all of your opponent’s Health Points, you’ll win immediately. At the end you will earn Victory Points by protecting your crystals, treasures, and Health Points you have earned from the Hero.

As the Hero, roll your dice to assault your opponent’s dungeon.
Move, fight Monsters, find Keys, and Treasures. If you find your opponent’s 3 Crystals you’ll win immediately. At the end you’ll earn Victory Points for stealing treasures, defeating monsters, conquering Crystals and the Life Points you keep.

—description from the designer

Name: Emplumados
Description:
Emplumados is a card game in which we will be bird watchers and our goal is to get the best score. Keep your cards of different Habitats and of higher value, waiting for the right moment to win a hand... But beware: Depending on the round, some cards can subtract points!

The game of Emplumados consists of 3 rounds.

Players take turns playing hands, and whoever played the best card wins the trick. At the end of the round, the points are counted, and there may be more valuable cards, and others that remain, depending on the score that appears on the Habitat Marker.

After 3 rounds, the total points are tallied and the one with the highest score wins. In case of ties, those players share the victory.


Emplumados es un juego de cartas en el que seremos avistadores de aves y es nuestro objetivo conseguir el mejor puntaje. Guardá tus cartas de diferentes Hábitats y de más alto valor, esperando el momento oportuno para ganar una mano... ¡Pero cuidado: Dependiendo la ronda, algunas cartas pueden restar puntos!

La partida de Emplumados consta de 3 rondas.

Por turnos, los jugadores jugarán manos, y quien haya jugado la mejor carta se llevará la baza. Al finalizar la ronda, se contabilizan los puntos, pudiendo haber cartas más valiosas, y otras que resten, dependiendo el puntaje que figura en el Marcador de Hábitat.

Luego de 3 rondas, se cuentan los puntos totales y aquel con el mayor puntaje gana. En caso de empates, esos jugadores comparten la victoria.

Name: A New Hope Limited Expansion Set: Star Wars Customizable Card Game
Description:
The A New Hope Limited set was the first full expansion set of the Star Wars Customizable Card Game. It consisted of 162 cards dividing into 81 Dark Side and 81 Light Side, and was introduced in July of 1996. This set consisted of 54 rare, 54 uncommon, and 54 common cards. This set introduced many of the classic characters from Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope, that were not included in the original base set, Premiere Limited. This set also introduced the first epic event cards, such as Commence Primary Ignition and Attack Run, to the game.

Important debuts in this set included Chewbacca and R2-D2. Also of note were the introduction of the Death Star as a system card, the introduction of creatures, and a new mechanic that allowed for the destruction of entire planets.

Name: Σινεμαχίες (Movie Battles)
Description:
